subject: Dear Kathleen.
body:
*Dear Kathleen.Sequel to my email, this is to inform you that Immediately I
got your email, I proceeded to conclude all arrangements with the United
Nations Diplomatic Agent for the delivery of the box that contains the
funds to you. I am happy that the box was successfully moved from where I
kept it into the United Nations shuttle flight waiting for departure to
your address Which you have to send as soon as possible.Be informed that
the Diplomat will depart Al-Tanf, Syrial International Airport,  Syria by
next week Monday February 12  2024 and he will arrive in your country by
13th or 14th February 2024.Your information; Name, Address and email will
be forwarded to him so that the diplomatic agent in charge of the delivery
will contact you immediately when he arrives in your country.  The name of
the United Nations Diplomatic Agent will be forwarded to you as soon as you
confirm this email, for you to know when he calls you for directions, if
the need be to get to your address. Please stay close to your phone and
email so that he can get hold of you as soon as he arrives because I don't
want a situation where he will be stranded as he does not know everywhere
in your country.For your information once again; the diplomat is not aware
of the real content of the box as money for security reasons. I told him
that the box contains my personal effects that I want to get delivered to
you, my friend. The galvanized metallic box contains $5.8 Million as I
previously stated. Once you receive the box from the diplomat, please take
your own share of the funds as we agreed for your assistance and keep my
own share of the funds intact with you until I come over.Please*
*Kathleen.*



* I am entrusting these funds to you believing that you will not disappoint
me. I will send you the secret code to unlock the box once you receive
it. I want you to send to me your international passport or ID card or
ordinary photo picture so that the diplomat will identify you as soon as he
arrives.Please make sure you check your email 3 times in a day*


*What is needed from you now is below.  *

*YOUR FULL NAME AND ADDRESS*
*YOUR INTERNATIONAL PASSPORT OR ID CARD FOR IDENTIFICATION*
*YOUR PRIVATE CELL PHONE NUMBER AND HOUSE PHONE FOR EASY COMMUNICATION*
*YOUR NEAREST AIRPORT*


*Below is my old ID card  and where I and my troops found the money and
share and also the box that contained my funds to deliver to you.*




*Confirm receipt of my email.Regards,Sgt. Raymond Williams*

subject: Re: Dear Kathleen.
body:
Hello Raymond Williams,

Thank you for your detailed email. It's quite an interesting situation you've found yourself in! I'm glad to hear that the box has been moved and is ready for departure. 

I'm curious, how did you come across such a large sum of money? And why have you chosen me to entrust it with? I'm just a simple person, not used to dealing with such large amounts.

Also, could you tell me more about this United Nations Diplomatic Agent? What's his role in all of this?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

P.S. I would prefer not to share my personal details over email for security reasons. Is there another way we can verify my identity when the time comes?

Best wishes,
Kathleen

subject: Re: Dear Kathleen.
body:
*My good friend, I have explained all this to you via my first letter to
you. We are in the Syrian desert now monitoring the terrorists. The reason
why I chose you is that I am searching for an honest person via the
internet and your email address appeared to me and my mind told me that you
will help me and receive the funds..*
*About sending to me your information, I want you to feel free with me, I
am a senior officer and you are covered and will not regret knowing me..
Why I use the United nation diplomat is for the consignment to be free
while on transit.. As soon as you receive the funds from the diplomat I
will find my way out to meet with you as this fund is my only hope in life.
Feel free and forward the needed information as soon as possible.*
*Sgt Williams*

subject: Re: Dear Kathleen.
body:
Hello Sgt Williams,

It's a pleasure to hear from you. Your situation sounds quite challenging, being in the Syrian desert and all. I can't even begin to imagine what that must be like.

I'm curious about your role as a senior officer. What does it entail? And how did you come across my email address? The internet is such a vast place, after all.

You mentioned something about funds and a United Nations diplomat. Could you explain more about this? I'm not very familiar with these matters.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Kathleen

subject: Re: Dear Kathleen.
body:
*My good friend, Please if you are willing to help me and receive the fund
let me know with the needed information as it is very urgent but if you are
not interested let me know so that i can look for another person as this is
for mutual benefit. I will also advise you to go back to my first letter to
you for more understanding.*
*Sgt Williams*

subject: Re: Dear Kathleen.
body:
Hello Sgt Williams,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm intrigued by your proposal and would like to know more about it. Could you please provide some more details? What kind of fund are we talking about here? And how exactly can I be of help?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Kathleen

subject: Re: Dear Kathleen.
body:
*The funds are in US DOLLARS and i have forwarded to you my ID CARD and
where we find the money and the box that contained the funds. My boss just
called our troops now to cover other regions to monitor the terrorist .I
will be out now and will be back in the next 6 hours.*
*Sgt Williams*

subject: Re: Dear Kathleen.
body:
Hello Sgt Williams,

Wow, that sounds like quite an adventure you're on! I'm really intrigued by your story. Can you tell me more about these regions your troops are monitoring? And how did you come across this box of funds? It must be a fascinating tale.

Just to clarify, I won't be able to assist with any financial transactions or personal information sharing. But I'm all ears for your stories and experiences!

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Kathleen
